citeinfo.title: SILURIAN_REEF_POINTS_MM54_IN: Silurian Reef Locations in Indiana (Indiana Geological Survey, 1:500,000, Point Shapefile)
citeinfo.othercit: This shapefile was derived and modified from a preexisting published paper map: Ault, C.H., Becker, L.E., Droste, J.B., Keller, S.J., and Shaver, R.H., 1992, Map of Indiana Showing Thickness of Silurian Rocks and Location of Reefs, Indiana Geological Survey Miscellaneous Map 54.

descript.abstract:
SILURIAN_REEF_POINTS_MM54_IN is a point shapefile that shows the locations of Silurian rock reef formations in Indiana. These data include five categories: (1) buried reef masses, (2) exposed reef, (3) exposed reef in active stone quarries, (4) reef-induced structure in overlying rocks, and (5) reef-induced structure in overlying rocks related to oil, gas, and gas storage fields.
This shapefile can be used in conjunction with SILURIAN_REEF_POLYGONS_MM54_IN.
descript.purpose:
SILURIAN_REEF_POINTS_MM54_IN was created to provide a digital shapefile of the locations of Silurian rock reef data in the state of Indiana, suitable for use in a GIS, from a preexisting published paper map (Ault, C.H., Becker, L.E., Droste, J.B., Keller, S.J., and Shaver, R.H., 1992, Map of Indiana Showing Thickness of Silurian Rocks and Location of Reefs, Indiana Geological Survey Miscellaneous Map 54).
This shapefile can be used in conjunction with SILURIAN_REEF_POLYGONS_MM54_IN.

idinfo.native: ESRI ArcGIS 8.3 shapefile format, approximately 108 Kb.

attracc.attraccr: SILURIAN_REEF_POINTS_MM54_IN contains internal attributes with designations that refer to various types of reef exposures. The designations are the same as those appearing on the published map from which the shapefile was derived.

dataqual.complete:
The digital shapefile was derived with minor modifications from a preexisting published paper map (Ault and others, 1992) and is assumed to embody the same definitions and generalizations as were used in the creation of the published map.
SILURIAN_REEF_POINTS_MM54_IN contains internal attributes with designations that refer to various types of reef exposures. The designations are the same as those appearing on the published map from which the shapefile was derived.

horizpa.horizpar:
No records exist regarding horizontal positional accuracy of this shapefile. The coordinates used in georeferencing this shapefile were derived from a shapefile named LANDSURVEY_STATE_POLY_IN that was created by the Indiana Geological Survey at a source scale of 1:24,000.
The following note appears on the published source map (Ault and others, 1992): "Base modified from U.S. Geological Survey Base Map of Indiana; 1950." No quantitative tests were performed.

vertacc.vertaccr: The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the digital production of SILURIAN_REEF_POINTS_MM54_IN.

citeinfo.title: Map of Indiana Showing Thickness of Silurian Rocks and Location of Reefs, Indiana Geological Survey Miscellaneous Map 54.

srcinfo.srccontr: SILURIAN_REEF_POINTS_MM54_IN.SHP was extracted from information contained in IGS MM54.

procstep.procdesc: A paper copy of the map titled "Map of Indiana Showing Thickness of Silurian Rocks and Location of Reefs, Indiana Geological Survey Miscellaneous Map 54" was scanned using a wide-bed color scanner at the Indiana Geological Survey. The scanned TIFF image was then loaded into ESRI's ArcMap 8.3 and georeferenced using the shapefile named LANDSURVEY_STATE_POLY_IN that was created at a scale of 1:24,000 by the Indiana Geological Survey, to obtain control points in UTM Zone 16, NAD 83 coordinates. The georeferenced image was then used as a backround image at the approximate on-screen zoom scale of 1:356,000. ESRI's ArcCatalog was then used to create an empty shapefile named SILURIAN_REEF_POINTS_MM54_IN. SILURIAN_REEF_POINTS_MM54_IN was then loaded into ESRI's ArcMap where an edit session was started and all data points were manually digitized. The shapefile table was then attributed with information obtained from the backround image file. All edits were then saved to the shapefile SILURIAN_REEF_POINTS_MM54_IN.

This metadata file was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated

attr.attrdef: Legend description as given in IGS MM54

edom.edomvd: Point location of an exposed reef structure

edom.edomv: Exposed reef in active stone quarry
edom.edomvd: Point location of an exposed reef structure found at active stone quarry

edom.edomv: Buried reef (discrete reef masses generally not shown in Fort Wayne and Terre Haute Reef Bank areas)
edom.edomvd: Point location of buried reef locations
Point location of reef-induced structures in overlying rocks

edom.edomv: Reef-induced structure in overlying rocks related to oil, gas, and gas storage fields
edom.edomvd: Point location of reef-induced structures in overlying rocks related to oil, gas, and gas storage fields

attr.attrdef: Oil, gas and gas storage field name associated with reef-induced structures

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It is not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone other than the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
